result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M. Conley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No 2015CF000113

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1550.00 is to be repaid in monthly increments of not less than $100.00 per month, commencing December 1, 2015.  In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with victims as named in the Complaint.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

14CF-182 and 15CF-113 - Both Cases Called @ 1:30 PM: Defendant Joseph M. Conley in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.   Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Argument as to SEH by DA.  Argument as to SEH by Atty Johnson.  Argues for lesser conditional time being imposed - agrees with other terms of supervision as requested by the State.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  Atty Johnson - states that Def has been released from sentence in Waupaca Co - remaining 30 days had been stayed.  The Court:  14CF-182:  Theft:  S/W - 2 yrs.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended; Ab Sob; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Rest TBD w/established payment structure; Costs plus DNA Surcharge - Sample ordered as to Felony BJump - 60 DTP or PP. 15CF-113:  OWI 4 PAC: S/W 2 yr probation concurrent to existing supervision.  Conditions: 75 days WCJ cond'l time with Huber and GT with 15 days TS credit; Rest owed 14CF-182; AODA and Ab Sob, the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; $1883 fine inclusive of costs; 30 mos DL rev/IID effective today; 60 DTP or PP.  Fel BJump:  S/W - 3 yrs probation.  Conditions same as to all 3 counts with additional N/C provisions with victims JE and LH.  Restitution Hrg to immediately commence.  LH sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA.  14CF-182 Ex 1 marked - entered and received.  Exam by Court as follow up.  Cross Exam by Atty Johnson.  Re Exam by Court as follow up. Continued Cross Exam by Atty Johnson.  Re Exam by Court as follow up.  Defendant sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by Atty Johnson. Cross Exam by DA.  Re-Direct by Atty Johnson.  Argument by DA Blader as to Rest Claim.  Argument by Atty Johnson as to Rest Claim.  The Court:  Factually a very difficult analysis by the Court as to Restitution.  Credible account by victim that $1400 was taken and reported to law enforcement.  Preponderance of evidence exists that $1400 was taken by Defendant.  Holds Def responsible for one can of coinage - $1550 to be repaid by Def - repaid in increments of no less than $100 per month commencing 12/1/2015.  Def must report forthwith on OWI charge.  Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 01:30 pm

14CF182 & 15CF113 Cases called @ 2:16 p.m.Defendant Joseph M. Conley in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Global offer recited by Atty Johnson. 15CF113 - Amended complaint filed by ADA Anderson adding a PAC charge. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 14CF182 - Upon motion of the State, the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Theft contrary to Wis. Stat. 943.20(1)(a).  Plea: 14CF182 - NC. 15CF113 - Cts 2 & 3 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  15CF113 - Ct 1 - Dismissed outright. 15TR1979 & 15TR1980 - DRI. The defendant must comply with the terms of bond in order for the offer to remain valid.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
